meanings.sent1: After realizing the pill was too big, she had to reswallow it.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally dropped the candy, picked it up, and reswallowed it.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful squirrel had to reswallow the same nut multiple times.
meanings.sent4: She had to reswallow her pride and admit she was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The magician made the coin disappear and then reswallow it in front of the amazed audience.

meanings.definition: To take back into the mouth and swallow again.
meanings.sent1: The baby would often reswallow his food to savor the taste.
meanings.sent2: She had to reswallow the bitter medicine to get better.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater would reswallow his food if he didn't like the first taste.
meanings.sent4: He had to reswallow his words after realizing he was mistaken.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to reswallow the fallen leaf as it flowed downstream.
